alert.note: Alert for Carteret; Hyde (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 22 at 4:19PM EST until December 22 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Hyde County in eastern North Carolina... Northeastern Carteret County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 515 PM EST. * At 416 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles southeast of Atlantic, or 20 miles east of Harkers Island, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Portsmouth Village, Ocracoke Light House, Ocracoke Ferry Terminal and Ocracoke Lighthouse. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. This thunderstorm is capable of producing all types of severe weather including extremely large hail, destructive winds and tornadoes. Move quickly to a safe shelter such as an interior room, a bathroom, closet or basement.
